isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 5 Engine Service Manual - Dual Stage Turbocharger Assembly - Cleaning and Inspection - Visual and Mechanical Inspection

svcproc.title: Visual and Mechanical Inspection

note.para: Replace turbocharger if any impeller or turbine blades are bent. Do not attempt to straighten blades.

svcproc.para: Compressor impeller and turbine wheel deposits can be caused by the following:

item.para: High air inlet restriction allows oil to transfer from the turbocharger center housing, resulting in oil deposits. Excessive oil consumption can result in turbine wheel carbon deposits. Replace turbocharger if turbine wheel deposits can not be cleaned off.
Engine over fueling can cause excessive temperatures which can cause aluminum components to melt.

step1.para: Each turbocharger shaft must spin freely when turned by hand. Inspect turbine and compressor housing for evidence of wheel rubbing, blade erosion, bending, or breakage. Replace turbocharger assembly if any of these conditions are found.
Perform same steps on adjacent turbocharger.
Inspect oil supply line for kinks, clogs, restrictions.
Inspect oil drain tubes for clogs, restrictions, and other defects.

With turbocharger in a stable position, place tip of a dial indicator with magnetic base
onto end of shaft (turbine side).

step2.para: Push shaft in either direction and hold in position.
Zero dial indicator face and needle.
Pull shaft in opposite direction and record measured distance on dial face.

If measurement exceeds Specifications
, turbocharger assembly must be replaced.

step1.para: Perform the previous steps on adjacent turbocharger.

figure.caption: Left - boost control test setup, Right - actuator rod

step1.para: Proceed with the following steps to inspect the boost control actuator:

step2.para: Remove tubing from boost control diaphragm.
Connect shop air and pressure regulator to the boost control diaphragm.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not exceed 207 kPa (30 psi) to the boost control diaphragm.

step2.para: Slowly regulate shop air to approximately 103 kPa (15 psi) and observe the actuator arm. It should begin to move at this pressure.
If the actuator rod does not begin to move at 103 kPa (15 psi) or if diaphragm is leaking, replace the dual turbocharger assembly.
